docs.lead_paragraph: Baba Eng had been a prisoner at Sing Sing for 22 years, serving a life sentence for murder, when a new inmate walked into the shower room one day and stared at his face. ''Dad!'' the stranger finally exclaimed.

headline.main: PARENTS IN PRISON: A special report.; As Inmate Population Grows, So Does a Focus on Children

docs.abstract: Special report, Parents in Prison, on harmful effects on children of having parent in prison, which is factor that puts child at greatest risk of becoming juvenile delinquent and adult criminal; some prison systems are trying to counter effect by creating special visiting areas for children or offering parenting classes, as some experts, such as Lawrence Sherman, warn that increasing incarceration rates may multiply problem in future; 1.96 million children have parent or other close relative in prison, and five million more have parents on probation or parole; link between generations is so strong that half of all juveniles in custody have close relative with record; such children often grow up amid poverty, abuse, neglect and drug use; children's center at Sing Sing described; Baba Eng, serving life for murder, tells of shock at meeting his son, now in same prison for armed robbery; photos (M)
docs.snippet: Baba Eng had been a prisoner at Sing Sing for 22 years, serving a life sentence for murder, when a new inmate walked into the shower room one day and stared at his face.    ''Dad!'' the stranger finally exclaimed.

docs.lead_paragraph: The graying of America has created an emerging industry: a wave of herbal and dietary supplements, books, courses and even clinics aimed at healthy people who are having trouble remembering and concentrating. On television commercials there is Annie Potts, who starred in ''Designing Women,'' extolling the wonders of that old standard, One-a-Day vitamins, now reformulated by Bayer A.G. with the herbal compound ginkgo biloba to sharpen memory. Hector Elizondo, star of the hospital drama ''Chicago Hope,'' is pitching the Warner-Lambert Company's Quanterra Mental Sharpness Product, which also contains ginkgo biloba.

headline.main: Industry's Next Growth Sector: Memory Lapses

docs.abstract: Aging of population spurs emerging industry offering herbal and dietary supplements, books, courses and even clinics to help people having trouble remembering and concentrating; sales of products containing ginkgo bilboa are growing, even though herbal compound's ability to stimulate memory is unproved; substance is only one of many supplements said to re-energize aging minds; photo (M)

docs.lead_paragraph: JACQUELYN GILBERT had just finished 20 weeks of chemotherapy and 4 weeks of radiation treatment in her battle against breast cancer. She was, by her own description, wiped out -- not exactly someone you would expect to see working out at a health club. Donna Brunton had finished her treatments for breast and colon cancer. Also recovering from a hysterectomy and still taking tamoxifen, an anti-tumor drug, she is not a woman you would imagine to be pumping iron.

headline.main: Exercising In the War On Cancer

docs.abstract: Article on new program run by Westchester County (NY) Medical Center's cancer institute and local health club that combines traditional oncological treatments with exercise and relaxation techniques (M)

docs.lead_paragraph: In an effort to tighten state rules on tobacco sales and more severely punish stores that sell to minors, an important legislative committee approved a bill today that would regulate nicotine as an over-the-counter drug. Two national antismoking groups said it was the first time a bill to regulate nicotine as a drug had survived any vote in a legislature. Under the measure, a retailer selling cigarettes would have to obtain the same permit the State Pharmacy Commission issues to those selling over-the-counter drugs.

headline.main: Bill Advances to Treat Nicotine as a Nonprescription Drug

docs.abstract: Connecticut Public Health Committee approves bill that would regulate nicotine as over-the-counter drug (M)
